content:
Yes, pole and line fishing remains the most common traditional fishing method employed in the Maldives, particularly for catching skipjack tuna, yellowfin tuna, and bigeye tuna. These types of tuna are abundant in the Maldives' waters and are essential resources for the country's economy.

Apart from tuna, other fish commonly caught using traditional fishing methods in the Maldives include bonito, reef fish such as groupers and snappers, and billfish like marlin, sailfish, and swordfish.

Fishermen in the Maldives have a deep knowledge of the fish they catch and use their expertise to make the most of traditional fishing techniques. The use of these techniques generally results in high-quality fish products that have a distinct flavor and texture, which are sought after both domestically and internationally.
